identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/New York Jets

abstract.p: Cincinnati Bengals receiver Carl Pickens says he is interested in signing with New York Jets if he is released by Bengals (S)

block.p: Carl Pickens, the disgruntled Cincinnati wide receiver, is expected to be released by the Bengals tomorrow and his agent said yesterday that Pickens was still interested in joining the Jets.
Carl Pickens, the disgruntled Cincinnati wide receiver, is expected to be released by the Bengals tomorrow and his agent said yesterday that Pickens was still interested in joining the Jets.
''That's the first call I will make,'' Steve Zucker said. ''That's where he wants to go.''

Although the Jets drafted two wide receivers and have Wayne Chrebet and Dedric Ward returning, none is taller than 5 feet 11 inches. Pickens, at 6-2 and 206 pounds, is closer in size to Keyshawn Johnson (6-3, 212), who was traded before the draft.
Coach Al Groh has indicated that the Jets may be interested in Andre Hastings, a free-agent wide receiver who was most recently with New Orleans.

Pickens had a stormy relationship with the Bengals, despite sighing a lucrative contract just before last season. The Jets have been non-commital about Pickens since it became obvious a month ago that the Bengals would cut him, and Bill Parcells, the director of football operations, has cast doubt on Pickens's viability because he is likely to seek about $3 million a year.
The Jets must still make salary cap room just to sign their three first-round picks.
